main event: A large cross-like aluminum-colored object was observed hovering and maneuvering before disappearing in Wheaton, Maryland.
interesting points: The object was observed for 18 seconds before it disappeared,The sighting occurred at 21:02 Z on August 16, 1956,The object moved from north to south before turning east and then toward the moon,Reported phenomena included a round, glowing object maneuvering at high speed and altitude,Weather conditions indicated clear visibility with 60% cloud cover during the sighting.
witness description: civilian observer with no further identity provided
